bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, December 26, 1885

div1.p: Reed is coming to Washington to apply for a leave extension. He plans to visit Florida, and then to visit New York City for coursework.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, December 26, 1885

opener.dateline:
No. 55 Freemason St.
Norfolk, Va.
Dec. 26th 1885.

div1.p:
Your very kind
favor of the 23rd just, came yes-
terday, & right glad was I to learn
that you were still alive
& flourishing- As I had al-
ready contemplated starting
to Washington on Monday next,
the 28th, I certainly shall not
now abandon the idea-
I come to Washington for the pur-
pose of getting my leave exten-
ded still further two months,
if it is possible- From Washing-
ton, I shall run down to
Florida on a short trip, & should
my leave be long enough, will
go on to New York early in
December & spend about 10
weeks in taking some special
courses. I am sorry that Mrs.
R. & children cannot accompany
me on my trip, but she is having
such a pleasant time with
her sister here that she prefers to
spend the hollidays with her-
I shall, if nothing happens, reach
Washington, Tuesday morning,
on Potomac Steamer, & as you
can't meet me, I will take
a car to your number --
Mrs. R. joins me in kindest
regards to your wife & self-

Please pardon the scratch,
& believe me, sincerely,
div1.closer:
Your friend, Walter Reed. To Dr. D. M. McPherson,
Washington, D.C.
